servinfo.title: DTC U0101: Lost Communication with TCM

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: Refer to DTC U0073: Control Module Communication Bus Off .

servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

entry.ptxt: Reception error of communication data for TCM is detected for longer than specified time continuously.

s1.ptxt: Clear DTC referring to “DTC Clearance” in this section.
Start engine and run it for 1 min. or more.

attention3.ptxt: Before this trouble shooting is performed, read the precautions for DTC troubleshooting referring to Precautions for DTC Troubleshooting .

testgroup.question: Was “Engine and Emission Control System Check” performed?

action.ptxt: Go to Step 2.
Go to Engine and Emission Control System Check .

testgroup.title: DTC check

test1.ptxt: Connect scan tool to DLC with ignition switch turned OFF.

Check for all control modules (ECM, TCM, BCM, ABS or ESP® control module, 4WD control module (if equipped), keyless start control module (if equipped), combination meter, steering angle sensor (ESP® model)) for DTC(s) other than CAN communication DTCs.

testgroup.question: Is there any DTC(s) other than CAN communication DTC(s) at each control module (other than DTC U0073, U0100, U0101, U0121, U0140, U1073, U1100, U1101, U1121, U1126, U1139, U1140, U1144)?

action.ptxt: Go to applicable DTC diag. flow.
Go to Step 3.

testgroup.title: DTC check
testgroup.question: Is DTC U0101 and U0073 detected together?

action.ptxt: Go to DTC U0073: Control Module Communication Bus Off .
Go to Step 4.

testgroup.title: ECM, ABS or ESP® control module and TCM connector check

test1.ptxt: Check for proper connection at each ECM, ABS or ESP® control module and TCM connector terminals with ignition switch turned OFF.
If connections are OK, recheck ECM for DTC with engine running.

testgroup.question: Is there DTC U0101?

action.ptxt: Go to Step 5.
Intermittent trouble. Check for intermittent referring to Intermittent and Poor Connection Inspection .

testgroup.title: ECM power and ground circuit check

test1.ptxt: Check ECM power and ground circuits referring to ECM Power and Ground Circuit Check .

testgroup.question: Are they in good condition?

action.ptxt: Go to Step 6.
Repair ECM power and/or ground circuits.

testgroup.title: DTC in TCM check
testgroup.question: Is DTC U0073 detected in TCM?

action.ptxt: Go to DTC U0073: Control Module Communication Bus Off .
Go to Step 7.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connectors from TCM and ECM with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check that CAN communication circuit is as follows.

item.ptxt: Circuit resistance of CAN communication circuit is less than 1 Ω between ECM connector and TCM connector.

action.ptxt: Go to Step 9.
Go to Step 8.

test1.ptxt: Measure resistance at following connector terminals.

item.ptxt: Between “WHT/BLU” terminal and “WHT” terminal of ABS or ESP® control module connector.
Between “WHT/RED” terminal and “RED” terminal of ABS or ESP® control module connector.

action.ptxt: CAN communication circuit wire between TCM and ECM connector is open or high resistance.
Substitute a known-good ABS or ESP® control module and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Connect connectors to ECM and TCM with ignition switch turned OFF.
Disconnect connector from BCM with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check ECM for DTC(s).

action.ptxt: Go to Step 10.

CAN communication circuit wire between BCM and CAN circuit junction connector is open or high resistance. If wires are OK, check BCM power and ground circuits. If circuits are OK, substitute a known-good BCM and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connector from keyless start control module (if equipped) with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check ECM for DTC.

action.ptxt: Go to Step 11.

CAN communication circuit wire between keyless start control module and CAN circuit junction connector is open or high resistance. If wires are OK, check keyless start control module power and ground circuits. If circuits are OK, substitute a known-good keyless start control module and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connector from combination meter with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check ECM for DTC.

action.ptxt: Go to Step 12.

CAN communication circuit wire between combination meter and CAN circuit junction connector is open or high resistance. If wires are OK, check combination meter power and ground circuits. If circuits are OK, substitute a known-good combination meter and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connector from 4WD control module (if equipped) with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check ECM for DTC.

action.ptxt: Go to Step 13.

CAN communication circuit wire between 4WD control module and CAN circuit junction connector is open or high resistance. If wires are OK, check 4WD control module power and ground circuits. If circuits are OK, substitute a known-good 4WD control module and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connector from steering angle sensor (ESP® model) with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check ECM for DTC.

action.ptxt: Go to Step 14.

CAN communication circuit wire between steering angle sensor and CAN circuit junction connector is open or high resistance. If wires are OK, check steering angle sensor power and ground circuits. If circuits are OK, substitute a known-good steering angle sensor and recheck.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connectors from all control modules (ECM, TCM, BCM, ABS or ESP® control module, 4WD control module (if equipped), keyless start control module (if equipped), combination meter, steering angle sensor (ESP® model)) with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check that CAN communication circuit is as follows.

item.ptxt: ALL wire harness resistance of CAN communication circuit is less than 1 Ω between each control module.
Insulation resistance between CAN communication circuit wires is infinity at each control module connector.
Insulation resistance between each CAN communication circuit wire and vehicle body ground is infinity at each control module connector.
Circuit voltage of CAN communication circuit is 0 V with ignition switch turned ON.

action.ptxt: Go to Step 15.
Repair or replace defective CAN communication circuit.

test1.ptxt: Connect connectors to all control modules communicating by CAN with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check DTC U1101 in BCM.

action.ptxt: Check TCM power and ground circuit. If circuit is OK, substitute a known-good TCM and recheck.
Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
